results.title: Suru = The Herd
results.creator_credit: Guney Film, Yilmaz Guney and Zeki Okten
results.brief_description:
A nomadic herdsman who has married a woman from a tribe with which his family has an ancient feud, takes a flock of sheep to sell in Ankara. On the way, some sheep die and others are stolen, and in the big city, the man is paid much less by a dealer than he was promised. Finally, his wife dies. Without preaching or sentimentality, the film exposes the hardships and injustices of Turkish society. Like ‘The Enemy’ and ‘Yol’, this film was supervised by Yilmaz Gueney from prison.

Credits: Producer, writer, Yilmaz Gueney ; director, Zeki Okten ; photography, Izzet Akay ; music, Zulfu Livaneli.
Cast: Tarik Akan, Melike Demirag, Tuncel Kurtiz, Levent Inanir, Meral Niron.

results.title: Surrounded: peer group membership
results.brief_description: Looks at the situation of two members of an adolescent group who each for different reasons does not wish to attend a weekend holiday with the others. Shows how they handle the pressure exerted on them by the other members of the group to conform. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Surrealism in art and music
results.brief_description: This video explores the history of the surrealist art movement. The first half, “Crisis in the Concept of Reality”, investigates the social conditions in Europe that led to surrealism. The human misery caused by the first World War led to many European artists taking on a nihilistic opposition to the values of Western civilisation. Influenced by the psychoanalytic theories of Freud, Dada was a precursor to Surrealism, in which the artist declared him or or herself as anti-art, anti-establishment. The second part, “A Torrent of Dreams” concentrates on the work of surrealist painters such as Miro, Dali and Magritte, musicians such as Erik Satie and the film-work of Cocteau, Dali and Bunuel. The onset of World War II led to an artistic exodus to America. New York City displaced Paris as the capital of the art world and painters such as Pollack and Johns, and musicians such as John Cage were influenced by the immigrant surrealists.

results.title: Surrealism and science: the weird world of Jean Painleve
results.brief_description: A compilation of nine films by Jean Painleve, scientist, pioneer scientific filmmaker and founder member of the Surrealist group. Painleve made over 200 scientific films, bridging the gulf that normally separates science from art and documentary from narrative cinema. Pioneering new techniques, he subverted the normally sober field of scientific studies by including outrageous jokes and comparisons in his underwater films and setting them to music ranging from Duke Ellington to Ravel. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Surrealism and Dada
results.brief_description: A film about the radical attack surrealism and Dada wrought on the familiar and traditional art values of the past. Through the perceptive choice of paintings and sculptures from the work of de Chirico, Duchamp, Man Ray, Ernst, Miro, Magritte, Dali, Klee and others, we become exposed to the philosophy, poetry and politics of these fascinating art movements. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Egons Tomsons and George Barford
results.brief_description: Traces the development of surrealism and its effect on modern art by studying the works of Ernst, Klee, Miro, Tanguy, Magritte, Dali and related painters outside the movement.

results.title: Surprising Amsterdam
results.creator_credit: Highlight Productions, Machiel Amorison and Mark Fekkes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Amsterdam is one of the world’s great cities, renowned for its historic and splendid museums and architecture, and its non-stop and exuberant night- life. The video shows us aspects of both medieval and modern Amsterdam. We are taken on a journey of the city’s famed canals. We visit the flower markets, the Van Gogh Museum, the 700 year old Dam Square, the Jewish section which houses the Anne Frank Museum and enjoy a Sunday afternoon in the beautiful gardens of the Vondelpark. Finally, after dark, we take a wander in the infamous “red-light” district.

results.title: Surplus government asset
results.brief_description: This short narrated documentary is an experimental film study of the Sydney showgrounds- it’s history, and it’s current use during the Royal Easter Show. It studies the culture of the past and present, as well as how and why the Show attracts a huge amount of both city and country people to the grounds once a year. The film presents a different point of view of the grounds and the social context in which it functions.

results.title: Surgery of varicose veins and ulceration
results.brief_description: The incidence of varicose veins and chronic ulcerations are given, and diagrams explain the venous supply to the legs and the abnormal conditions which can develop and cause trouble. The film explains pre-operative treatment. The operation itself is followed step by step and explanations are given of the various processes. The film ends with some close-up views of the instruments used, some of which were obtained from the Mayo Clinic.

results.title: Surgery in chest diseases
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, British Council and A. Reginald Dobson
results.brief_description: A study of a civilian Chest Surgery Centre, showing all the stages in medical treatment from early diagnosis by mass radiography to rehabilitation and final cure. A patient is diagnosed as having a cancer of the lung, and the operation for total removal of the lung is shown in detail.
